attributes.action: Open gyms in lockdown to help with mental health and well-being.
attributes.additional_details: Some people’s mental state has been helped by going to the gyms keeping fit and healthy something which was badly effected by the first lockdown of schools where hundreds and thousands of house holds will be mixing once children go to and from school the gyms should be allowed to open if only for shorter hours.
attributes.background: Open gyms during lockdown to help with mental health and well-being even if it’s for a shortened amount of hours.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign some of these petitions:

Keep gyms and leisure facilities open during any lockdown: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/556956

Prevent gyms closing due to a spike in Covid 19 cases: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/333869

The Committee will be holding a debate on Covid-19 restrictions on gyms and sport on Monday 23 November. You will be able to watch the debate on Parliament TV at 4.30pm: https://www.parliamentlive.tv/Commons
